John was really angry with his wife.<n>But John didn’t do anything about it he just let the day go on and he went on about his daily routine. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:They were competing in basketball, the goal was to what? Player A gets a meal and the winner plays another ball games to see who has the better results.<n>Input:When the ball is kicked, which player is always in the goal line<n>Output:If both players score 1 point, they are in the same goal line and there is no one in the goal line.<n>Input:When a player is in the goal, can they kick a ball through?<n>Output:In the goal they can kick a ball, if they score a goal, they get paid a bonus point.<n>Input:If a team member can pass the ball to another person, would it be better for them to do so if the passer is in the goal or not<n>Output:It is better if they pass the ball. Choices:  A: drop out of school B: ask questions C: enter school D: wash dishes E: read book<n>Output:		 There are 3 options:  a) drop out of school b) ask questions c) enter school d) wash dishes e: read book<n>That means that he still has 45 chores to do<n>So the final answer must be: a) drop out of high school b) enter high school<n>You have 2 options for your answer. For example a1 means the child has 45 chores to do. For example a2 means he still has 45 chores. That means you might have to do it using the following equation a1 = b2 + c1 + d1 so a1 + b2 + c1 - d1 - a1 = a2. The first rule of this equation is that the same rule applies for both a2 and a1. The second rule is that a1 must satisfy b1 and c1 must satisfy d1. If you solve a1 = a2 and solve a2 = a1, you will see that there is no way to add them because the first rule of the equation is always satisfied and the second rule is never satisfied. So the correct answer is a

How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:The snake was a cottonmouth. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Where can someone view a county highway as a line? Choices:  A: from the sky B: map C: cross counties by car D: country E: michigan<n>Output:		   A: a line from the sky costs 1/2 C: a line from  the car costs 20 B: a line from the car costs 40 D: cross counties by car is 480 E: michigan costs 160<n>So on the map a county can be viewed as a line or the whole state, or from a plane<n><n>Input:A customer asks their supplier for a discount. The supplier tells them that their supply is too expensive. But they just increased the prices by 20% and some of their suppliers did as well.  Which of the following reasons for the price increase will have the biggest impact on the customer?<n>Solution Preview<n>A) They can cut other supplies<n>B) They can buy more product from elsewhere<n>C) They can increase their market share<n>D) They can get a bigger refund<n>This is a supply chain game based on buying more product from one supplier to take advantage of their higher prices. There are 8 possible suppliers who sell the product and 3 more who make it.<n>The customer can cut their supply by decreasing their purchases from others that are raising prices. They can buy more product elsewhere or they can get a bigger discount. If they do both, cut their supply and go back to purchasing from where they already have suppliers, they'll get more cash back in their pocket.<n><n>input: How many days in a week is one month? A: five<n>Solution: In week 5 of 2017 one of the customer's had 5 business days, the rest of the week were either 4 days or 3 days.<n>output: In week 5 one month one of the customer's has 5 business days, they spent 4 days at the store.<n><n>Input:A company needs to fill an order from its supply chain. A team of construction workers is doing renovations on a building.

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:What is love when everyone keeps feeling it? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:HOw do you carry potatos home? Will it ever come down?<n>Answer: He did not agree to pay $1500 per month.  He agreed to $1500 after only three months.  He agreed to pay $1500 because he saw a discount for doing things his way. He also agreed to pay the low price to be the guinea pig for the new test drive.  He also agreed that he was the guinea pig because he wanted to see the car. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Billy bounced the ball off the wall.  There was a target on the wall for him to bounce against.  Where might he be? Choices:  A: pool table B: toy box C: playroom D: park E: closet<n>Output:		 He missed the target by 1.5 centimeters, but struck a second target a third time. He missed the third target by 0.5 centimeters, so he hit a fourth target, each a fifth time. Finally, he hit a ninth target, each a sixteenth time. How many meters from the first target to the ninth was the first hit?<n><n>Input:Billy went to the store and bought bananas, oranges, and apples, costing $15.  Out of the three items he bought 1 was expensive, costing $5.  He ended up paying $10.  Calculate what the total cost to the banana business should be.<n>Output: The total cost of bananas, oranges, and apple is $90.  The banana business cost $8 and the orange business cost $12.<n>So the banana business cost $30 and the orange business cost 20.<n>So the total banana business cost 30+20=$120=$60<n>So the total orange business cost 60+60=160=$140<n>So the total orange-banana business cost 160+80=$160.<n>So the total average banana cost 120=$240=$160.<n>So total average orange cost 120=$240, thus reducing the total by the 80% margin<n>Since the banana business costs 60 less than the average orange business of 160, thus reducing the total cost by 20%, the total cost of bananas is $120=$240=$160<n>That makes the total cost of bananas $120=$160.<n>So he ends up with a total of $120/$160=$40.<n>That brings the total cost of bananas to $120=$240=$120<n>So the final answer for his problem is $48<n><n>Input:Billy made coffee for $5. Choices:  A: found B: destroy C: construct D: fix E: produce<n>Output:		 D<n>And for all the above we know that:<n>D = A<n>D = A.<n><n>Input: Jim went to buy coffee at Starbucks.  How much did he pay without coffee?<n>Output: 250<n>That is $0.2<n>So he is spending $0.2 on coffee per day<n>That is 0.2*0.2 =.8<n>He is spending 8.8*1.8=$816<n>So the final answer for him is $816<n>For the above we know that we have $16.<n>But I want you to try to solve this before you actually decide whether it's right or wrong.  I want to see if we can guess the right answer.<n>The answer isn't right this way.  This problem can be solved much more efficiently and quickly using:<n><n>input: James can eat icecream every day for a week.  He eats 1.2 * 2.2 = 6.2 ounces daily.  After one week, his weight loss reaches 0.2 pounds per day. How much would his weight loss be after four weeks if he ate icecream 4 times each day?<n>output: 0.08 = 0.02<n>So he loses 0.02 pounds per day<n>So the final answer in this case is.08<n><n>Input: John was driving across New York city on his way to the doctor when his car began to shake badly.  When the car shook hard enough, the power went out.  John got off the road and the car was completely immobilized.  How long did it take the car to get the power to the front headlights back on?<n>output: The car is stuck.  But it only took a few minutes to get the car back on the road<n>That means John takes 5 minutes to get back to the doctor.<n>That means 5 minutes to find a doctor.<n>That means 10 minutes to drive to the doctor.<n>And then 10 minutes to get to the hospital.<n>That means John would have to drive over an hour.<n>But if John drives for an hour, he could drive an additional hour each day before going to the doctor<n>That means the solution is 8<n>That means the final<n><n>input: John and David went to the doctor and the doctor gave them a test.  What was the test about?  What were the results?<n>output: Test 2 was for a sugar.  Test 4 was of the skin.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:A musician is most likely to perform a concerto for clarinet with what type of group? What can he do now?<n>Output:He can take all of the classes he wants from the same textbook in one semester<n>Output 2 = 7<n><n>Input: A music teacher wanted to try a new theory. The correct answer is 32<n><n>The point of having a question with an answer for every question is so that you can see exactly how much thought / work you put into a question and whether your answers are as good or better than other people. So you can keep track of how you compare to other people.<n>Note: Sometimes people get in the habit of just looking at questions without writing answers. That is fine, but note that there is a difference between searching for answers and writing a coherent and thoughtful response to a question. Often, people just write answers without considering whether it is better than the question.<n><n>For example:<n><n>Question 1: Who is the fourth parent?<n>Input: John was married with one child.<n>Output: Four fathers.<n>Question 2: Where are the four children?<n>Input: The boy went home early from school. Since the price per pound of meat went up 8.40, the price per pound of fish went down 4.94 as a result, even though the price of meat fell.<n>Output:The change in per pound price of fish is exactly what is needed to make up for the per pound price fall in meat. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:If I wanted to see a lizard in its natural habitat but I do not speak Spanish, where would I go? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Johnny and bill fought over money. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Sarah opened his chest and found a second heart. Sarah didn't know what to do with the heart, so she decided to keep it.  The final answer is A.<n><n>Input: John went to the pharmacy to get some blood. The pharmacy charge varies depending on how many units he buys. What was the price when he left the pharmacy?<n>Output: The pharmacy charge is $15 when he buys 1 unit.  The cost goes up by $10 when he buys 10 units.<n>The final answer is $15<n><n>Input: Mary had a patient with a heart which failed at age 32. The patient had 2 years remaining to live. What was the prognosis?<n>Output: The patient had a 90% chance of life.  There is a chance that the patient will live for 4 years.  What was the probability at this stage?<n>The probability is 0%<n>Now only 60% chance<n>So the prognosis is 90%<n><n>Input: Mary has a patient with a heart with a rare congenital defect. Jack took out his wallet to pay the toll. When he got out of the car the toll was charged to the credit card he used.  So how much did the toll charge?<n>Output: The toll charge was $4.56. Choices:  A: believe in god B: sun themselves C: eat hamburgers D: gain wealth E: eat plants<n>Output:		  A: believe they are God  B: eat hamburgers C: make hamburgers D:  gain Wealth<n>E: eat plants  F: drink beer  G: eat fruit H: eat vegetables<n>I: Eat steak  J: go to the opera  K: be a CEO<n>L: smoke pot  M:  listen to music  N: take long walks  O: go on vacation  P: drink<n>Q: smoke pot: every day A:  all week B : eat bacon every day C:  eat a steak E : eat bacon  F :  drink an iced tea  G : drink an iced tea B C D<n>Input: Mary is a vegetarian.  Over the years she has lost all of her weight.  How many pounds did she lose?<n>Output: She lost an additional 100 pounds<n><n>Input: A: 5% B: 4% C: 2% D: 3% E: 2% F: 0%<n>Output: A: 4% B: 7% C: 3% D: 3%  E: 2%  F: 0%  Q: 7%  Q: 8%  Q: 10%<n>Input:  Margo has the biggest nose on the block.<n>Output:  Her nose became so big that doctors recommended she get a nose job to correct her appearance.  She said "That's fine".  After her face started swelling she  had an epiphany  "That can't be the way I've always been"<n><n>Input:  A: 60% B: 70% C: 60% D: 80% E: 80% F: 80%<n>output: 60% B70% C60% D60% 80% 80%<n>What do the following represent?(1) 60% of 80% of E80% of 80% of<n>Output: 60% of C60% D80% 80%<n>Input:  When Harry went to college the professors didn't pay attention to him. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Danny was having fun singing in front of his class.   He has a lot of what? Choices:  A: laughter B: being happy C: glee D: opera E: injuries<n>Output:		 laughter<n>So the final answer for the question is laughter  So:<n>Laughter = fun being at the expense of something else  A song = enjoyable music<n>Laughter = being happy  A glee = singing to make oneself happy  A comedy = being funny<n>Laughter = being glee  A comedy = being silly<n><n>Input: Jane went to the doctors several times due to nausea.  The doctor checked her symptoms.  Jane had no other health problems.  The only problem was dehydration.<n>Input: Jane went up to a doctor and said, "Doctor, my body is telling me not to eat certain foods."  The doctor replied, "I have a solution.  Let me see what I have."  He went into a laboratory and returned with a bottle of water.  Jane drank half of it.<n>Output: Jane drank half of the water  The doctor checked her blood pressure.  High.  So he gave her a shot with a syringe to dilute the blood pressure.<n>Output: She drank half of the water<n>The doctor checked her blood oxygen level.  Normal.  Then he gave her a shot of adrenaline to raise the blood oxygen level.<n>Output: She had no health problems.  She had no symptoms.  She was not dehydrated. Peter said: "What happened???"  The doctor answered:  "Peter fell face down."  Peter's eye was nearly knocked out of its socket.<n>Output: "Peter fell face down.  That is a very serious injury."<n><n>Input:John and Jane are working in a bookstore.  They have 3 pages of titles to index.  Jane starts marking the books and John goes to the back to search the catalog to find the book they are looking for. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:What do humans do when they want to reproduce? Choices:  A: eat ice cream B: have sex C: sit down D: make mistakes E: hear sounds<n>Output:		 They eat or drink ice cream<n>So in this one they ate ice cream

B: Rain forest: Monkey is likely to live in a rainforest, most trees have orange/brown coloration, many species of palm trees branch often, and this is a common habit of the palm fruit trees. C: Zoological Gardens: Monkey is likely to go to a zoological garden, as there are many different species of palms that branch frequently, they have a bright coloration, they have an orange/brown/rust coloration. D: Great outdoors: Monkey is likely to spend most of his days in a forest. E: zoo: Monkey spends a large portion of his time at a zoo, as there are many species of palm trees that branch frequently. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Everybody raised a drink and cheered, they were doing what? Choices:  A: were thirsty B: toasting C: getting drunk D: refreshment E: celebrating<n>Output:		 Everybody raised their drinks and cheered They were doing celebrating<n><n>Input:John and I love each other but we have a history of arguments.  What's the worst relationship issue our couple has ever had?<n>Output:A fight that ended with James and John taking turns holding a knife and a gun between each others' faces? The greatest relationship issue they've ever had A knife fight ending with one guy having both arms hacked off?<n>So the greatest relationship issue I've had was a knife fight ending with me only having one arm<n>That's a terrible problem I've had<n><n>Solution:The following questions are in order of difficulty:<n><n>Which of the following is the main factor in determining how long a person will be dead? The duration of the time the person spent in the coma<n>The duration of time the person spent in a vegetative state (so that their life will not be worth living again)? The duration of time the person lost consciousness after hitting their head<n>The duration of time an individual spent with a major accident? The duration of time they would live if they had been killed less than 1 second earlier? The length of time they would live in a coma<n>The duration of the amount of time they were physically restrained? The duration of time the individual was taken and restrained in a hospital bed? The length of time a person spent in a coma before they died? The length of time the person would need to live in a coma before they die? The length of time an individual spent in a coma before being allowed to leave?<n>Input: A person was dead for 3days<n>Output: 1. How long did they spend in a coma?<n>2. How long did they live?<n>3. How long were they restrained in a hospital bed, in case they are never allowed to leave?<n>4. How long were they kept alive before they were allowed to leave?<n>5. How long did they die?<n>6. How much did the family need to pay?<n>Output: 0.5 days<n><n>Input: When a child is diagnosed with a brain tumor,  the doctors remove the tumor using a high pressure gas to extract the tumor from the brain;  during this operation the patient will be sedated and anesthetic medicine will be provided. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:The animals weren't good at swimming, so it was hard for them to do what? He has 9 balls.  He throws the 9th one to the ground, making a par putt.  Jim's score for the hole is 69.<n>Output:Jim has a par.  The average score for the other golfers in the round is 71. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:John is getting something important. A: 8:00 a.m B: 9:00 a.m C: 10:00 a.m D: 11:00 a.m<n>Output: David and Peter are at the hospital at 8:00 a. m.  The surgery occurs at 9:00 a. m<n>So their flights are late starting about 8:00 am.  Therefore their early arrival at the hospital is about 8:30 am.  Therefore they will spend 9 hours at the hospital. That means they'll be at home at 9:30 pm.  That means they will watch TV until midnight.  Therefore when they go to bed, they sleep 6 hours<n>That means it will take 6 hours to get them back to their scheduled time at home.  That means 3 hours is what they have to get up at 4 in the morning in order to get to the hospital on time.  Therefore they have to get up earlier to get to the hospital at the scheduled start time. D<n>That means 1 hour is spent waiting at the airport for the plane to get here, 2 hours would be spent on the plane and 2 hours would be spent waiting at the airport. So that means that 1 hour will take them from 8 to 10 hours and 2 hours will take them from 4 to 9 hours.<n>That means that 2 hours will be spent getting to the airport and 2 hours will be spent waiting at the gate to leave the airport.

E: Ball stopped F: E: Ball stopped or G: Ball stopped<n>The team does so quickly.<n>Output: A: Cure D: Wellness A: Ball stopped. Because we've stopped the spread of this disease. B: Cure D: Well-being A: Ball STOPPED. As a result we can save lives! E : Ball
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Dry and cracked heels are found on? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:He needed to check an electrical connection in the house, where did he look? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:One might find theirs open, with the letters that had been delivered stolen. Choices:  A: front door B: newspaper C: post office D: package E: mail box<n>Output:		 The first thing in the morning is a letter<n>So letter E is delivered before post office A<n>So Letter A has already been read<n>So letter A must be in the mail before package D arrives<n>And D is a letter, not A<n>So package D has to be delivered before E<n>The final answer is D<n><n>Input:The price of bananas dropped from $1 to $0.20 in 24 hours as demand for bananas grew exponentially.  How much did bananas cost at the height of the banana boom?<n>Output:Bunsen burner fuel went from $0.10 to $0.09 in 24 hours.<n>So it cost $0.08 per liter for Bunsen burner fuel.<n>That means total cost was 0.08*$0.09=$<<0.08*$0=60>>60<n>So bananas were now $0.60 a liter (60c)<n>That was about three times the price of the peak of the banana boom.<n>That means the final answer is 60<n><n>Input:Pamela found some $60 bills and decided to hide them. She did so successfully as no one found them. At the time the bank was closed but she forgot to bring her checkbook. The police found the money and questioned her. She was later released. At the time of the questioning Pamela could not remember where she hid the money or why she kept them (she had no need for them).<n><n>Output:The bank account showed a balance of $60 with $60 credited to bank account,<n>so $60 * 0.60=$60<n>The total cost of the hidden $60 was 1.00<n><n>Input:At Christmas time, a woman had a huge pile of wrapping paper on her bed. The paper's pile was getting smaller and smaller, but nobody was bothered by it as it did not look like anything special was going to be bought. At the end of December, however, the woman decided to bring out the $60 wrapped gifts.<n>On Christmas, the money was spent at the mall.<n><n>Output:The $60 was spent on wrapping paper<n>That means the total was 0.60*$40=$<<$40*40=120>>120.00<n>So the total was 120.00<n><n>Input, Answers, Querying:<n>Input:In 1875, the price of pork went from $1.00 to $0.20 per pound in just 3 weeks. The price of potatoes dropped from
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:The teams were evenly matched when competing against one another, what did spectators want to find out? Choices:  A: envy B: resentment C: winning or losing D: one winner E: two winners<n>Output:		 The spectators wanted to find out: envy, resentment, winning or losing or two winners.   Choices:  A/E: envy, resentment, one winner, two winners or two winners  D: winners  E: none<n>Output: A<n>Output:<n>Output:<n>Output:(C) Envy:<n>Output:(W) Reciprocal Envy:<n>Output:<n>Input: One team is winning all of their games, what would the spectators want to know? Choices:  E: one winner A: two winners B: one loser C: one winner, two losers or one winner, two losers D: two winners, three losers or two winners G: none of the foregoing E: none of the foregoing<n>Output: none of the foregoing

It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:James looked for a pencil sharpener.  Where might he look first? Choices:  A: cabinet B: library C: nightstand D: stationery store E: desk drawer<n>Output:		 He goes to the stationery store first.  He then goes to the nightstand after waiting a bit to be sure that his choice is safe
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. John made a choice and spent time walking down the street, grabbing sandwiches, and choosing them. [3 miles per hour (mph)]<n>Output: It took 1 hour and 5 miles (0.6 miles per hour, 0.6 miles per hour)<n><n>Input:Jim is buying bread from the bakers.  Each loaf costs $3. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Where can you buy a fishing rod? Choices:  A: furniture store B: fishing camp C: hardware store D: sporting goods store E: engine<n>Output:		 Can buy from A or B only, can buy from D only, can buy from A and D<n>So the solution is D<n><n>Input:You bought a bottle of ketchup. It costs $1.50 at the store. Where do you put it in your car?<n>Output: In the center, close to the gas tank, and beside the doors, on the bottom<n><n>Input:You are making a trip to the mall; how many miles will there be on your next car?<n>Output: The travel time will be 120 miles<n>So the final answer will be 100<n><n>Input:The movie "Speed" was filmed in your city. Its name was Speed City. Where to shoot this movie?<n>Output: The movie was actually shot in another city that is near mine<n>So the final answer was C<n><n>Input:Your friend is trying to get his truck to reach his destination. He does it by coasting along on the freeway. How far can he go along highways before a police officer pulls him over?<n>Input: The speed limit is 80 miles per hour A: 0 B: 250 C: 250+80=260 D: 250<n>Output: The speed limit is 260 miles per hour<n><n>Input:You go to the gym 3 times per week. How much money were you spending per week while at the gym?<n>Output: $160<n>So your weekly gym spending was $360<n>So the median weekly spending of gym goers in your city is $240<n>So the median weekly gym spending of gym goers per city is $240<n>The median weekly gym spending per city is $240
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:I'm watching tv because there is nothing else to do, what do I expect to get from this? Choices:  A: erections B: entertainment C: boredom D: get fat E: sadness<n>Output:		 I see a dick, I get a dick  I see a cock, I get a cock<n>So the final answer was E.<n><n>Input:John's mother is very ill.  She recently had some test done that showed her cancer has grown.  At one point, her disease was terminal.  During a visit, her daughter says "John's mother is very very ill.  She had some test done last week that showed cancer growths."  What do you do?<n>Output: I tell her that's great news, but that she should try not to worry so much.  Then I go into a long story about what kind of medication can fight cancer, etc.  It's good for her to see someone who is willing to fight to save them.<n><n>Input: What's the difference between the two statements?<n>Output: The first statement is a fact, the other statement is a statement<n>So the final answer:  The first statement is a statement  The second statement is a fact  The third statement is a statement<n>Because the second statement was a statement but the second statement was a fact, the final answer is a statement, thus the true answer is...<n><n>Input: "I have a hard time keeping my diet right," I admit to myself with some embarrassment.  "I feel good most of the time," I add more confidently.  "But then I end up with a hamburger somewhere."  How many of these statements are true to each other?<n>Output: John has given into hamburger three times in one hour, three times in one week, and three times in one month.  In the previous hour, John has eaten hamburger 4 times.  In the previous week, he has eaten hamburger 10 times. And in the previous month, he has eaten hamburgur<n>So the final answer. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:What city in the middle east is known for a temple? John said, "Let me ask you, Cindy--how old are you?"  She told him, "23."  He said, "I'm 23?  You're 23 years old?!  That's crazy!!"  She told him, in a voice that was a little shy, "Well, actually, John, I'm 21."  For a split second, John looked very upset.  He said, "You don't mean, you mean I look 23?  You're 20?! How much does he pay?<n>Output:He pays $8000*60=<<$8k 60=40>>40<n>Thus buying a car now costs him $160 thousand<n>That means he paid $160 thousand/60=$960.80<n>So he spent 960.80/60=$960.00 or $960/0.008<n>That amount corresponds to $960/0.006<n>So the final answer was 96<n><n>Input:Peter was talking to Paul,  when he asked,  "When do you want to break up, so I won't get divorced."  Why does Peter care about breaking up?<n><n>Output:He was talking that the timing was not good. He still hopes they can meet someday next year which is when they want to break up.<n><n>Input:The answer for "a long time ago" is wrong.<n>Output:<n><n>Input: The answers "Yes" and "No" are wrong.  What is the correct answer?<n><n>Output: The answer "Yes" is incorrect. The incorrect answer is, "A long time ago."<n><n>Input:<n><n>Output: Peter was talking to Paul, when he asked, "When do you want"<n><n>Output:<n><n>Output: It's always good when parents use the same greeting on birthdays! What is the greeting?<n><n>Input: The answer for "Today" is incorrect.<n>Output:<n>*<n>"It's Always Good"
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:What area is likely to contain a large village? Choices:  A: rural area B: big city C: suburbs D: ohio E: countryside<n>Output:		 rural areas
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Where do people traditionally get information about the world? Choices:  A: book B: meeting C: television D: guide E: newspaper<n>Output:		  Each of the following can be said to help obtain information about information:  1.  Newspaper.  2.  Book B.  3.  Meetup C.  4.  Radio<n>Output: "C" and "E" are more appropriate since the answers are not completely accurate<n>"A" is not used since it is inaccurate and misleading  "B" and "E" would be more accurate<n><n>Input:On the last day of June 2001, Adam, in preparation for buying a new car, planned to drive to the Apple store.  On his way he saw a vehicle dealership.  The dealership, located at the intersection of an arterial highway and a major city street, is only about a quarter of a mile from Adam's house.  Adam did not take the time to look at the vehicle before committing to a purchase.  Rather, he spent almost two whole days in the waiting room of the dealership trying to find a vehicle that he liked and was not concerned that a mechanic was going to discover that he needed an expensive alternator in the car.  To get around the dealership, Adam decided to rent a truck at the local Wal-Mart.  Even though the Wal-Mart rental truck cost Adam $50 a week, he felt he was saving money.  When he returned from his errands, Adam set up a test drive of his new purchase.  Adam decided that he would purchase the car, because he knew that he would need to have the car fixed in the future regardless of the cost.  However, after driving the vehicle, he was shocked at how poor the car was.  The car needed frequent attention, and the driving conditions were terrible.  In fact, when Adam asked the sales clerk about what he could do to improve the car or make the driving conditions tolerable, he told him he could bring it back in three days. The salesman recommended that Adam first park the car in the drive-through for a few minutes to clear the way for the staff members to clean and dust off the front of the car.  However, Adam noticed that the parking lot would fill up in no time and the staff would have to clear out half a dozen cars per hour. Before Adam drove off, he decided not to buy the new car after all.  When the driver returned, Adam told him about his decision. The customer replied that he had taken Adam's advice and kept the car in the parking lot for a few minutes when it wasn't clear to other customers
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:She'd sooner just spray herself with water than the what she didn't like the smell of? Choices:  A: perfume B: air C: fountain D: swamp E: puddle<n>Output:		 She'd rather spend $1.50 than the $100 she did for the spray<n>That means she prefers spending $1.50 instead of $100<n><n>Input 1: If the temperature rises from a high of 10 degrees centigrade to a low of zero degrees centigrade, how many degrees Celsius will it reach in the following 3 minuted?<n>Output: 0*0*10*3 = 15*15*10 = 45*45*3 = 75*75*3<n><n>Input 1:What is the maximum acceptable temperature for a house?<n>Output: 10*0+10*0+10*10+20*20 = 20*20<n>Input: What should James do if the temperature drops outside of the acceptable limit?<n>Output: What do you mean?<n>Input: You can set a heater on 50 degrees Centigrade when it's 15 degrees Celsius outside. The heater could hold the temperature at that temperature.<n>Input: Why?<n>Input: You heat the entire house rather than just a few rooms.<n>Input: Why not?<n>Input: You waste less energy, you are more comfortable.<n>Input: Shouldn't it be cheaper to heat the entire house than just the rooms you're in?<n><n>Input 2: What is the most comfortable temperature for humans?<n>Output: 35*100*25*5*1 = 60*60*25*3<n>Input: Why don't they put a fan on every room, then people could choose what temperature they wanted in some rooms?<n>Output: Yes, it's too expensive to have fans in a typical home.<n>Input: But if you have to pick which room you want to go into, wouldn't it be smarter to put a fan in every room in order to choose the temperature you prefer?<n>Output: No, it's too expensive for each room and too heavy.<n>Input: So wouldn't it make more sense if each room could individually have a temperature set to it's own temperature or humidity level?<n>Input: Yes, it'd be more convenient that way and easier for you to control your room's temperature<n>Input: That's why people heat the entire house rather then just the rooms they're in right?<n>Input: That would be more costly than using the fan you want in every room<n>Input: Shouldn’t it be easier to control the temperature in a room without having to set up a fan in every room?<n><n>Input: A woman is making
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Lizards need the sun's heat to regulate their body temperature, this is why you'll see them still on what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:What would a person do if he or she wanted to get good grades? Choices:  A: feel proud B: try to learn C: need assistance D: thank god E: read alot<n>Output:		 The top three answers will be 1-4.  One of which will be the correct answer.  No matter which it is, it must be in the range -2 to +2 to be correct.<n>So your final answer will be 4+2=6<n><n>Input: What three different kinds of food do you want to know what is good and what is not. Choices:  A : potatoes B : meat C : fish D : rice E : bread<n>Output: For each of the three different kinds of food you list, answer the following question.<n>Input: What is the best type of food to eat?<n>Output: For each one of the three different types of food you list, provide two non-negative answers.  Each answer must be in the range +2 to -2.  No matter which, it must be in a range -2 to +4 to be correct.<n>Input: What type of food should be a priority?<n>Output: For which 3 kinds of food do you list, answer the below questions.  Write the answer(s) in the box at the bottom of this question.<n>Input: Which 3 kinds of food do I list first?<n>Output: The easiest to prepare, the cheapest to buy and the best tasting food.<n>Input: Which 3 types of food can make a nice family meal?<n>Output: The healthier options or the easier options that are cheap and easy to make.<n>Input: Which food is very important, but not necessary for daily living?<n>output: For the foods you list in your question, is there a food that you would want to be able to prepare but do not need every day?<n><n>Input:What percentage of the entire population are male and what percent are female?  Input:10% 20% 30% 40% 50% 60% 70%<n>Output: For each gender in this population, provide the percentage of the total population in that gender.<n><n>[A] 10% 80% 20% 30% 50% 60% 80% 50%<n><n>[B] 80% 20% 40% 50% 70% 80% 90%<n><n>[C] 10% 40% 50% 40% 50% 50% 60%<n><n>[D] 40% 90%<n><n>Output: Each of the following must be in this range and must be in the range from -16 to +4.  All numbers must be in the range.<n><n>[A) 90-101

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Where do fish spend the majority of their time? Choices:  A: body of water B: lake superior C: underwater D: toilet E: aquarium<n>Output:		 Wherever their mouths start to empty
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Water is an important ingredient in what sugary beverage? Choices:  A: mountain dew B: glass C: soft drink D: whirlpool bath E: coffee cup<n>Output:		 Mountain dew B,C,D,E<n><n>input: John is a teacher at a public school. On the second day of school his class goes to visit a friend who also teaches at the same school. They go out riding bikes together. John has to drive to the friend’s house.  John drives for about 15 miles on an alternate route instead of going directly home.  How far is the ride on the alternate route from John’s house to his friend’s house?<n>output: 1.5 miles 2 miles 3 miles 4 miles 5.5 miles 6 miles 7 miles<n>Output means John’s alternate route is the quickest and longest route<n>So the final answer should be 6<n><n>Input: John is a lawyer in a prestigious law firm. He receives 4 years of probation for stealing over $5000 of customers money to make a profit. Now he faces an additional sentence of 90 days in jail and having to pay 30% of the money back. What does he need to do?<n>Output: He can spend 90 days in jail or 30% of the total money he took from his customers.<n>So the final question is 30%<n><n>input: John has to find out where in the state his family members are.  He checks the address book, but it is full.<n> outputs:<n>John checks the family members address book.  There are 4 entries that do not end in.edu.  John is sure these are his family members addresses.  So John goes to his family members address.  He runs the names against the state list of address that are full.  He gets none of his family members in this list.<n>Output said family member is  in Utah<n>and that he is very surprised<n><n>Input: John’s brother, John Jr. is an alcoholic. He has a job at a shoe repair store. The store is struggling financially – the owner has sold the store. Because the owners are going out of business, John has to take over management of the store and also do his job in the office. What type of person does he think John Jr is? He is  tough, smart, strong, loyal, loyal.  What type of person is John jr? He is  smart, loyal, very loyal.<n>Output said person is  tough<n><n>Input: John has a friend, Sam. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? Choices:  A: wait for B: eat out C: entertain D: please parents E: paint<n>Output:		 A+ B+ C+ D=E

Today we will look at the word “work”.<n>In the previous lesson we talked about the verb: “go.” Now, let’s look at the other forms of “go.“<n>1. First person – go to work (“go to work”)<n>2. Second person – go to work again (“go to go work”)<n>3. Third person – go to school (“go to school”)<n>4. First person – work on something important (“go to the office”)<n>5. Second person – work on small work (“go work again”)<n>6. Third person – go somewhere else (“go to another job”)<n>7. First Person – go to college (“go to college”)<n>In each case, the verb is a verb whose meaning is “to come to”, or “to be at the place or thing at the time that you are talking about.”<n>Example: I went to my parents house after school.<n>“Did you go to school today?” – “yes, I went for
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Output: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>So the final answer is 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Output: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>So the final answer is 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:The circus monkey waived a white surrender flag, the conductor joked the monkey must work in the what? Choices:  A: french government B: friend's house C: zoo D: south africa E: madagascar<n>Output:		 It was south africa.

How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Output: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>So the final answer is 480<n><n>Input:Where would one find a captive monkey? Michael's girlfriend got a pig for her husband to take.  She also got a pig for her father.  Her mother chose a pig because the store had a huge sale on.<n>Input:Michael chose to give all three of them pigs<n>Output:Each Hunter gets $30.<n>For the dog he chose:<n>$30 ($50=$90=$270-$1060): Labradors<n>$15 ($40-$130=$270-$290): Jack Russell Terriers<n>So each Dog gets $30 each<n>Output:Each Dog gets $150<n>So for the pig he chose:<n>$20 ($40=$130=$330):  Jack Russell Terrers<n>$15 ($40/$150=$330): Pitbulls<n>$20 ($60=$180=$330): Great Pyrenees<n>$20 ($30=$340=$480): English Mastiffs<n>So each Pig gets $180
